title: Cognitive Load Theory and Simulation-Based Instructional Design Strategies

context.prior_knowledge: Advanced theoretical knowledge and mastery of high-level application skills
context.additional_context: Practical course applying cognitive load theory to social studies lesson design for prospective teachers

learning_goals: Learners can classify the three types of cognitive load (intrinsic, extraneous, germane) according to actual classroom contexts.
Learners can optimize social studies lesson design using simulation tools while measuring and adjusting cognitive load factors.
Learners can simulate student roles in a VR environment to empirically derive cognitive load management strategies for instructional design.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
